thread.title: Comment about girlfriend's 'OK' pasta leads to police standofff
thread.title_full: Comment about girlfriend's 'OK' pasta leads to police standofff

author: BRIAN LISI
title: Comment about girlfriend's 'OK' pasta leads to police standofff
text:
Boyfriend's comment about girlfriend's 'OK' spaghetti dinner leads to hours-long standoff with NH police Comment about girlfriend's 'OK' pasta leads to police standofff   11:02 AM 
Things weren't so merry-nara. 
Jodi Ecklund of Merrimack, N.H., barricaded herself inside her apartment with a Glock 9mm and a M4 assault rifle after her live-in boyfriend told her that her spaghetti dinner was "OK," NH1 reports. 
Before fleeing the apartment and calling police, Jason Martin was allegedly punched in the face and arm by his girlfriend, who locked the door once he left. 
When officers with the Merrimack Police Department arrived, Ecklund allegedly warned officers she would kill them if they entered her residence. Jodi Ecklund, 33, was arrested for domestic violence, criminal threatening, and reckless conduct after she assaulted her boyfriend in Merrimack, N.H. (Merrimack police) 
As the standoff continued Saturday afternoon, the piqued provider of pasta began destroying items inside the apartment, even going so far as to launch some of Martin's possessions out a window to the parking lot below. 
Finally, after several hours, authorities gained access to the apartment and took Ecklund into custody. 
She has since been charged with six felonies, including criminal mischief, criminal threatening and eckless conduct, as well as three misdemeanor counts of domestic violence. Tags:
